newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Solvay no plan to follow Petro to NYSE.
newsitem.headline: Solvay no plan to follow Petro to NYSE.

text.p: Belgian chemicals group Solvay said on Thursday it had no immediate plans to follow fellow Belgian industrial company PetroFina to the New York Stock Exchange.

"For the time being we are pleased with our (American Depositary Receipts) in New York and we have not decided to do anything else," Solvay chief executive officer Daniel Janssen told a news conference on first-half 1997 results.
A planned 10-for-one common stock split, due on August 28, would not change that, he said. After the split, one ADR will be equivalent in value to Solvay common shares listed in Europe.
"We have used the ADR programme as a stepping stone to New York. We will see if one day we find it useful to do more than that step. That day has not arrived," Janssen added.
PetroFina, the first Belgian group to apply for a full New York quote, said separately on Thursday its planned listing should take effect on September 3.
The appointment last year to the NYSE board of prominent Belgian banker Georges Ugeux has raised expectations that other Belgian groups may follow PetroFina's lead.
